intro: Swertia diluta var. tosaensis, commonly known as Tosa Swertia, is a perennial herb native to Japan. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
